001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.StringReader;
005import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
006import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
007import java.net.URI;
008import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
009import java.util.ArrayList;
010import java.util.Arrays;
011import java.util.Comparator;
012import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
013import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.Map;
016import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
017import java.util.Objects;
018import java.util.Optional;
019import java.util.Properties;
020import java.util.Set;
021import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
022import java.util.function.BiFunction;
023import java.util.function.Function;
024import java.util.function.Supplier;
025import java.util.regex.Matcher;
026import java.util.regex.Pattern;
027
028import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
029
030import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.ChangePublisher.ChangeType;
031import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.MutableLogProperties;
032import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyFunction;
033import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter;
034import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter.ChildPropertyGetter;
035import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter.RequiredPropertyGetter;
036import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter.RootPropertyGetter;
037import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.RequiredResult;
038import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.Result;
039import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.CaseChanging;
040import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.LogConfigurable;
041
042/**
043 * Provides String based properties like {@link System#getProperty(String)} for default
044 * configuration of logging levels and output. Since Rainbowgum is configuration agnostic
045 * LogProperties is a simple string key and string value interface to allow almost any
046 * configuration implementation. The only required method to implement is
047 * {@link #valueOrNull(String)} and thus LogProperties is a functional like interface but
048 * using {@link LogProperties#builder()} is preferred so that a
049 * {@linkplain #description(String) description} can be added.
050 * <p>
051 * If a custom {@link LogProperties} is not configured the default RainbowGum uses System
052 * properties.
053 * <p>
054 * The builtin properties to configure RainbowGum are modeled after <a href=
055 * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.1.0/reference/html/features.html#features.logging">
056 * Spring Boot logging </a>
057 * <p>
058 * LogProperties should generally be accessed with the {@link PropertyGetter} and
059 * {@link Property} like-monads which will allow safe <em>programmatic</em> data
060 * conversion of the flat key values and useful error messages to users if the property
061 * cannot be mapped or is missing. For more <em>declaritive</em> injection of properties
062 * see {@link LogConfigurable} which will generate builders that can use LogProperties.
063 * <p>
064 * Rainbowgum treates {@value #SEP} in the keys as special separator analogous to
065 * Javascript/JSON and various other configuration systems. Furthermore to work with a
066 * wide set of configuration systems once a property key has a value it is
067 * <strong>RECOMMENDED</strong> that there should not be other property key value with a
068 * key that is a prefix of the previously mentioned key. For example allowing two
069 * properties <code>logging.example=stuff</code>, <code>logging.example.a=A</code> is not
070 * recommended as <code>logging.example</code> is defined as a leaf. The exception to this
071 * rule is logging levels mapped to logger names for consistency with Spring Boot.
072 * <p>
073 * A convention used through out Rainbowgum is to have the property names as constants as
074 * it makes documentation easier. These constants name are suffixed with
075 * <code>_PROPERTY</code> or <code>_PREFIX</code> the former being a fully qualified key
076 * that maybe parameterized and the latter being a partial key ending with
077 * "<code>.</code>". The fully qualified keys are like leaves on a tree.
078 * <p>
079 * Property keys can be paramertized by using
080 * {@link LogProperties#interpolateKey(String, Map)} and a general pattern is
081 * <code>logging.component.{name}.prop</code> where {@value #NAME} is a parameter. Many
082 * property constants use this to allow multiple configuration of components by name.
083 *
084 * <table class="table">
085 * <caption><strong>Builtin Property Patterns</strong></caption>
086 * <tr>
087 * <th>Property Pattern</th>
088 * <th>Description</th>
089 * </tr>
090 * <tr>
091 * <td>{@value #LEVEL_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = LEVEL</td>
092 * <td>Sets the level for the logger. If logger name is missing then it is considered the
093 * root logger. {@link Level#INFO} is the default level for the root logger.</td>
094 * </tr>
095 * <tr>
096 * <td>{@value #CHANGE_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = boolean |
097 * List&lt;{@link ChangeType}&gt;</td>
098 * <td>Allows runtime changing of levels for the logger. By design RainbowGum does not
099 * allow loggers to change levels once initialized. This configuration will allow the
100 * level to be changed for the logger and its children and by default is false as the
101 * builtin {@link LogProperties} is generally static (system properties).</td>
102 * </tr>
103 * <tr>
104 * <td>{@value #ROUTES_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
105 * <td>A comma separated list of routes that should be enabled. If not set
106 * {@value LogRouter.Router#DEFAULT_ROUTER_NAME } is the default.</td>
107 * </tr>
108 * <tr>
109 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
110 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders associated with the route. If not set
111 * {@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} is ued.</td>
112 * </tr>
113 * <tr>
114 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY} = <code>URI</code></td>
115 * <td>Looks up a publisher by URI scheme using the {@link LogPublisherRegistry}. The
116 * publisher is then configured by properties with {@value #PUBLISHER_PREFIX}.</td>
117 * </tr>
118 * <tr>
119 * <td>{@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
120 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders that should be enabled. If not set
121 * {@value LogAppender#CONSOLE_APPENDER_NAME} is the default.</td>
122 * </tr>
123 * <tr>
124 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
125 * <td>Looks up an output by URI scheme using the {@link LogOutputRegistry}. The output is
126 * then configured by properties with {@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX}.</td>
127 * </tr>
128 * <tr>
129 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
130 * <td>Looks up an encoder by URI scheme using the {@link LogEncoderRegistry}. The encoder
131 * is then configured by properties with {@value #ENCODER_PREFIX}.</td>
132 * </tr>
133 * <tr>
134 * <tr>
135 * <td>{@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
136 * <td>Configures the named output. The name of the output usually comes from the
137 * appender.</td>
138 * </tr>
139 * <tr>
140 * <td>{@value #ENCODER_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
141 * <td>Configures the named encoder. The name of the encoder usually comes from the
142 * appender.</td>
143 * </tr>
144 * <tr>
145 * <td>{@value #FILE_PROPERTY} = URI</td>
146 * <td>A URI or file path to log to a file. This is for Spring Boot compatibility.</td>
147 * </tr>
148 * </table>
149 *
150 * @see LogConfigurable
151 */
152public interface LogProperties {
153
154        /**
155         * properties separator.
156         */
157        static final String SEP = ".";
158
159        /**
160         * Logging properties prefix.
161         */
162        static final String ROOT_PREFIX = "logging" + SEP;
163
164        /**
165         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
166         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
167         */
168        static final String LEVEL_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "level";
169
170        /**
171         * Logging change properties prefix.
172         */
173        static final String GLOBAL_CHANGE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.change";
174
175        /**
176         * Logging change properties prefix.
177         */
178        static final String CHANGE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "change";
179
180        /**
181         * Logging file property for default single file appending. The value should be a URI.
182         */
183        static final String FILE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "file.name";
184
185        /**
186         * A common key parameter is called name.
187         */
188        static final String NAME = "name";
189
190        /**
191         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
192         */
193        static final String OUTPUT_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "output.{" + NAME + "}.";
194
195        /**
196         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
197         */
198        static final String ENCODER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "encoder.{" + NAME + "}.";
199
200        /**
201         * Enabled Logging appenders. The value should be a list of names. This is equivalent
202         * to {@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} with name "default".
203         */
204        static final String APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "appenders";
205
206        /**
207         * Logging appender prefix for configuration.
208         */
209        static final String APPENDER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "appender.{" + NAME + "}.";
210
211        /**
212         * Output appender property.
213         */
214        static final String APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "output";
215
216        /**
217         * Encoder appender property.
218         */
219        static final String APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "encoder";
220
221        /**
222         * Logging publisher prefix for configuration.
223         */
224        static final String PUBLISHER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "publisher.{" + NAME + "}.";
225
226        /**
227         * Routes enabled with names comma separated.
228         */
229        static final String ROUTES_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "routes";
230
231        /**
232         * Route prefix for configuration.
233         */
234        static final String ROUTE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "route.{" + NAME + "}.";
235
236        /**
237         * Logging publisher URI property.
238         */
239        static final String ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "publisher";
240
241        /**
242         * Appenders associated with a route comma separated.
243         */
244        static final String ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "appenders";
245
246        /**
247         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
248         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
249         */
250        static final String ROUTE_LEVEL_PREFIX = ROUTE_PREFIX + "level";
251
252        /**
253         * Analogous to {@link System#getProperty(String)}.
254         * @param key property name.
255         * @return property value.
256         */
257        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key);
258
259        /**
260         * Gets a list or null if the key is missing and by default uses
261         * {@link #parseList(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
262         * as a list using {@link LogProperties#parseList(String)} but custom implementations
263         * may rely on their own parsing or the data type is builtin to the backing
264         * configuration system.
265         * @param key property name.
266         * @return list or <code>null</code>.
267         * @apiNote the reason empty list is not returned for missing key is that it creates
268         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
269         */
270        default @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key) {
271                String s = valueOrNull(key);
272                if (s == null) {
273                        return null;
274                }
275                return parseList(s);
276        }
277
278        /**
279         * Gets a map or null if the key is missing and by default uses
280         * {@link #parseMap(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
281         * as map using {@link LogProperties#parseMap(String)} but custom implementations may
282         * rely on their own parsing or the data type is builtin to the backing configuration
283         * system.
284         * @param key property name.
285         * @return map or <code>null</code>.
286         * @apiNote the reason empty map is not returned for missing key is that it creates
287         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
288         */
289        default @Nullable Map<String, String> mapOrNull(String key) {
290                String s = valueOrNull(key);
291                if (s == null) {
292                        return null;
293                }
294                return parseMap(s);
295        }
296
297        /**
298         * Searches up a {@value #SEP} separated path using this properties to check for
299         * values.
300         * @param root prefix.
301         * @param key should start with prefix.
302         * @return closest value.
303         * @see #searchPath(String, Function)
304         */
305        default @Nullable String search(String root, String key) {
306                return search(root, key, (p, k) -> p.valueOrNull(k));
307                // return searchPath(key, k -> valueOrNull(concatKey(root, k)));
308
309        }
310
311        /**
312         * Searches up a {@value #SEP} separated path using this properties to check for
313         * values.
314         * @param <T> result type
315         * @param root prefix.
316         * @param key should start with prefix.
317         * @param func convert function
318         * @return closest value.
319         * @see #searchPath(String, Function)
320         */
321        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
322        default <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T search(String root, String key,
323                        BiFunction<LogProperties, String, @Nullable T> func) {
324                return searchPath(key, k -> func.apply(this, concatKey(root, k)));
325        }
326
327        /**
328         * Describes a key and by default is usually just the key.
329         * @param key key.
330         * @return usually the key.
331         */
332        default String description(String key) {
333                return key;
334        }
335
336        /**
337         * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A higher
338         * number gives higher precedence.
339         * @return zero by default.
340         */
341        default int order() {
342                return 0;
343        }
344
345        /**
346         * Abstract log properties builder.
347         *
348         * @param <T> builder.
349         * @apiNote this abstract class can largely be ignored hence why it is sealed.
350         */
351        public sealed abstract class AbstractBuilder<T> {
352
353                protected @Nullable String description = null;
354
355                protected int order = 0;
356
357                protected Function<String, String> renameKey = s -> s;
358
359                protected List<LogProperties> fallbacks = new ArrayList<>();
360
361                /**
362                 * Ignored.
363                 */
364                protected AbstractBuilder() {
365                }
366
367                /**
368                 * Add a fallback properties.
369                 * @param properties fallback not null.
370                 * @return this.
371                 */
372                public T from(LogProperties properties) {
373                        this.fallbacks.add(properties);
374                        return self();
375                }
376
377                /**
378                 * For returning this.
379                 * @return this builder.
380                 */
381                protected abstract T self();
382
383                /**
384                 * Description for properties.
385                 * @param description not null.
386                 * @return this.
387                 */
388                public T description(String description) {
389                        this.description = description;
390                        return self();
391                }
392
393                /**
394                 * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A
395                 * higher number gives higher precedence.
396                 * @param order order.
397                 * @return this.
398                 */
399                public T order(int order) {
400                        this.order = order;
401                        return self();
402                }
403
404                /**
405                 * Renames the key before it accesses function.
406                 * @param renameKey rename key function.
407                 * @return this.
408                 */
409                public T renameKey(Function<String, String> renameKey) {
410                        this.renameKey = renameKey;
411                        return self();
412                }
413
414                enum Format {
415
416                        PROPERTIES() {
417                                @Override
418                                Map<String, String> toMap(String content) {
419                                        var m = new LinkedHashMap<String, String>();
420                                        StringReader reader = new StringReader(content);
421                                        try {
422                                                PropertiesParser.readProperties(reader, m::put);
423                                        }
424                                        catch (IOException e) {
425                                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
426                                        }
427                                        return m;
428                                }
429                        },
430                        URI_QUERY() {
431                                @Override
432                                Map<String, String> toMap(String content) {
433                                        return parseMap(content);
434                                }
435                        };
436
437                        abstract Map<String, String> toMap(String content);
438
439                        Function<String, @Nullable String> parse(String content) {
440                                return toMap(content)::get;
441                        }
442
443                }
444
445        }
446
447        /**
448         * Builder for properties.
449         */
450        public final static class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
451
452                private @Nullable Function<String, @Nullable String> function = null;
453
454                private Builder() {
455                }
456
457                @Override
458                protected Builder self() {
459                        return this;
460                }
461
462                /**
463                 * Sets what is called on {@link LogProperties#valueOrNull(String)}.
464                 * @param function valueOrNull func.
465                 * @return this.
466                 */
467                public Builder function(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Function<String, @Nullable String> function) {
468                        this.function = function;
469                        return this;
470                }
471
472                /**
473                 * Parses a string as {@link Properties}.
474                 * @param properties properties as a string.
475                 * @return this.
476                 */
477                public Builder fromProperties(String properties) {
478                        function = Format.PROPERTIES.parse(properties);
479                        if (description == null) {
480                                description = "Properties String";
481                        }
482                        return this;
483                }
484
485                /**
486                 * Parses a string as a URI query string.
487                 * @param query uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and
488                 * key value separator of "<code>=</code>".
489                 * @return this.
490                 */
491                public Builder fromURIQuery(String query) {
492                        function = Format.URI_QUERY.parse(query);
493                        return this;
494                }
495
496                /**
497                 * Parses a string as a URI query string. If the URI has no query portion then it
498                 * will be equivalent to empty properties.
499                 * @param uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and key
500                 * value separator of "<code>=</code>".
501                 * @return this.
502                 */
503                public Builder fromURIQuery(URI uri) {
504                        String query = uri.getRawQuery();
505                        if (query == null) {
506                                query = "";
507                        }
508                        if (description == null) {
509                                description = "URI('" + uri + "')";
510                        }
511                        function = Format.URI_QUERY.parse(query);
512                        return this;
513                }
514
515                /**
516                 * Builds LogProperties based on builder config.
517                 * @return this.
518                 */
519                public LogProperties build() {
520                        var f = this.function;
521                        if (f == null) {
522                                if (!fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
523                                        return LogProperties.of(fallbacks);
524                                }
525                                throw new IllegalStateException("function is was not set");
526                        }
527                        String description = this.description;
528                        if (description == null) {
529                                description = "custom";
530                        }
531                        var first = new DefaultLogProperties(f, description, renameKey, order);
532                        if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
533                                return first;
534                        }
535                        List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
536                        combined.add(first);
537                        combined.addAll(fallbacks);
538                        return LogProperties.of(combined);
539                }
540
541                static abstract class AbstractLogProperties implements LogProperties {
542
543                        protected final String description;
544
545                        protected final Function<String, String> renameKey;
546
547                        protected final int order;
548
549                        public AbstractLogProperties(String description, Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
550                                super();
551                                this.description = description;
552                                this.renameKey = renameKey;
553                                this.order = order;
554                        }
555
556                        @Override
557                        public int order() {
558                                return this.order;
559                        }
560
561                        @Override
562                        public String description(String key) {
563                                String rename = renameKey.apply(key);
564                                String desc = "'" + key + "' from " + description;
565                                if (!rename.equals(key)) {
566                                        desc += "[" + rename + "]";
567                                }
568                                return desc;
569                        }
570
571                        public String toString() {
572                                return getClass().getSimpleName() + "[description='" + description + "', " + "order=" + order + "]";
573                        }
574
575                }
576
577                private static final class DefaultLogProperties extends AbstractLogProperties {
578
579                        private final Function<String, @Nullable String> func;
580
581                        public DefaultLogProperties(Function<String, @Nullable String> func, String description,
582                                        Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
583                                super(description, renameKey, order);
584                                this.func = func;
585                        }
586
587                        @Override
588                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
589                                return func.apply(renameKey.apply(key));
590                        }
591
592                }
593
594        }
595
596        /**
597         * A log properties that can be mutated like a map.
598         */
599        public interface MutableLogProperties extends LogProperties {
600
601                /**
602                 * Assigns key to a value.
603                 * @param key key.
604                 * @param value value if null will remove the key.
605                 * @return this.
606                 */
607                MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value);
608
609                /**
610                 * Copy Java Util {@link Properties} String useful for unit testing.
611                 * @param content string in {@link Properties} format (tip use multiline strings).
612                 * @return this.
613                 */
614                default MutableLogProperties copyProperties(String content) {
615                        var m = AbstractBuilder.Format.PROPERTIES.toMap(content);
616                        for (var e : m.entrySet()) {
617                                put(e.getKey(), e.getKey());
618                        }
619                        return this;
620                }
621
622                /**
623                 * Builder for MutableLogProperties.
624                 * @return builder.
625                 */
626                public static Builder builder() {
627                        return new Builder();
628                }
629
630                /**
631                 * Mutable Log properties builer.
632                 */
633                public final class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
634
635                        protected Map<String, String> map = new LinkedHashMap<>();
636
637                        private Builder() {
638                        }
639
640                        @Override
641                        protected Builder self() {
642                                return this;
643                        }
644
645                        /**
646                         * Sets the backing mutable map.
647                         * @param map backing map.
648                         * @return this.
649                         */
650                        public Builder with(Map<String, String> map) {
651                                this.map = map;
652                                return this;
653                        }
654
655                        /**
656                         * Parses a string as {@link Properties} useful for unit testing with Java
657                         * multiline string literal.
658                         * @param properties properties as a string.
659                         * @return this.
660                         */
661                        public Builder copyProperties(String properties) {
662                                map.putAll(Format.PROPERTIES.toMap(properties));
663                                return this;
664                        }
665
666                        /**
667                         * Builds a mutable log properties.
668                         * @return mutable log properties.
669                         */
670                        public MutableLogProperties build() {
671                                String description = this.description;
672                                if (description == null) {
673                                        description = "custom mutable";
674                                }
675                                var first = new MapLogProperties(map, description, renameKey, order);
676                                if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
677                                        return first;
678                                }
679                                List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
680                                combined.add(first);
681                                combined.addAll(fallbacks);
682                                return new CompositeMutableLogProperties(sort(combined));
683                        }
684
685                        private static final class MapLogProperties extends LogProperties.Builder.AbstractLogProperties
686                                        implements MutableLogProperties {
687
688                                private final Map<String, String> map;
689
690                                public MapLogProperties(Map<String, String> map, String description, Function<String, String> renameKey,
691                                                int order) {
692                                        super(description, renameKey, order);
693                                        this.map = map;
694                                }
695
696                                @Override
697                                public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
698                                        return map.get(renameKey.apply(key));
699                                }
700
701                                @Override
702                                public MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value) {
703                                        Objects.requireNonNull(key);
704                                        key = renameKey.apply(key);
705                                        if (value == null) {
706                                                map.remove(key);
707                                                return this;
708                                        }
709                                        map.put(key, value);
710                                        return this;
711                                }
712
713                        }
714
715                }
716
717        }
718
719        /**
720         * LogProperties builder.
721         * @return builder.
722         */
723        public static Builder builder() {
724                return new Builder();
725        }
726
727        /**
728         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
729         * @param logProperties list of properties.
730         * @param fallback if the logProperties list is empty.
731         * @return log properties
732         */
733        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties, LogProperties fallback) {
734                if (logProperties.isEmpty()) {
735                        return fallback;
736                }
737                if (logProperties.size() == 0) {
738                        return logProperties.get(0);
739                }
740                var array = sort(logProperties);
741                return new CompositeLogProperties(array);
742        }
743
744        private static LogProperties[] sort(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
745                var array = logProperties.stream()
746                        .filter(p -> p != StandardProperties.EMPTY)
747                        .toArray(size -> new LogProperties[size]);
748                Arrays.sort(array, Comparator.comparingInt(LogProperties::order).reversed());
749                return array;
750        }
751
752        /**
753         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
754         * @param logProperties the list of properties.
755         * @return if the logProperties is empty {@link StandardProperties#EMPTY} will be
756         * used.
757         */
758        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
759                return of(logProperties, StandardProperties.EMPTY);
760        }
761
762        /**
763         * Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for
764         * URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
765         * @param uri query will be used to pull properties from using
766         * {@link #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)}.
767         * @param prefix part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI
768         * properties.
769         * @param properties usually this is the properties coming from {@link LogConfig}.
770         * @return combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query
771         * parameters.
772         */
773        public static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties) {
774                String query = uri.getRawQuery();
775                query = query == null ? "" : query;
776                var uriProperties = LogProperties.builder()
777                        .fromURIQuery(query)
778                        .renameKey(s -> LogProperties.removeKeyPrefix(s, prefix))
779                        .build();
780                return LogProperties.of(List.of(properties, uriProperties));
781        }
782
783        /**
784         * Parse a {@linkplain URI#getRawQuery() URI query} in <a href=
785         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
786         * application/x-www-form-urlencoded </a> format useful for parsing properties values
787         * that have key values embedded in them. <strong>This parser unlike form encoding
788         * uses <code>%20</code> for space as the data is coming from a URI.</strong>
789         * @param query raw query component of URI.
790         * @param consumer accept will be called for each entry and if key (left hand) does
791         * not have a "<code>=</code>" following it the second parameter on the consumer
792         * accept will be passed <code>null</code>.
793         */
794        public static void parseUriQuery(String query,
795                        @SuppressWarnings("exports") BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
796                parseUriQuery(query, true, consumer);
797        }
798
799        /**
800         * Parses a URI query formatted string to a Map.
801         * @param query raw query component of URI.
802         * @return decoded key values with last key winning over previous equal keys.
803         * @see #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)
804         */
805        public static Map<String, String> parseMap(String query) {
806                Map<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
807                parseUriQuery(query, (k, v) -> {
808                        if (v != null) {
809                                m.put(k, v);
810                        }
811                });
812                return m;
813        }
814
815        /**
816         * Parses a URI query for a multi value map. The list values of the map maybe empty if
817         * the query parameter does not have any values associated with it which would be the
818         * case if there is a parameter (key) with no "<code>=</code>" following it. For
819         * example the following would have three entries of <code>a,b,c</code> all with empty
820         * list: <pre>
821         * <code>
822         * a&amp;b&amp;c&amp;
823         * </code> </pre>
824         * @param query raw query component of URI.
825         * @return decoded key values with multiple keys grouped together in order found.
826         */
827        public static Map<String, List<String>> parseMultiMap(String query) {
828                Map<String, List<String>> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
829                BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> f = (k, v) -> {
830                        var list = m.computeIfAbsent(k, _k -> new ArrayList<String>());
831                        if (v != null) {
832                                list.add(v);
833                        }
834                };
835                parseUriQuery(query, true, f);
836                return m;
837        }
838
839        /**
840         * Parses a list of strings from a string that is <a href=
841         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
842         * percent encoded for escaping (application/x-www-form-urlencoded)</a> where the
843         * separator can be either "<code>&amp;</code>" or "<code>,</code>".
844         * <p>
845         * An example would be using ampersand: <pre><code>
846         *  "a&amp;b%20B&amp;c" -> ["a","b B","c"]
847         *  </code> </pre> and comma: <pre><code>
848         *  "a,b,c" -> ["a","b","c"]
849         *  </code> </pre>
850         * @param query the comma or ampersand delimited string that is in URI query format.
851         * @return list of strings
852         */
853        public static List<String> parseList(String query) {
854                List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
855                parseUriQuery(query, true, "[&,]", (k, v) -> list.add(k));
856                return list;
857        }
858
859        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
860                parseUriQuery(query, decode, "&", consumer);
861        }
862
863        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, String sep,
864                        BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
865                String[] pairs = query.split(sep);
866                for (String pair : pairs) {
867                        int idx = pair.indexOf("=");
868                        String key;
869                        String value;
870                        if (idx == 0) {
871                                continue;
872                        }
873                        else if (idx < 0) {
874                                key = pair;
875                                value = null;
876                        }
877                        else {
878                                key = pair.substring(0, idx);
879                                value = pair.substring(idx + 1);
880                        }
881                        if (decode) {
882                                key = PercentCodec.decode(key, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
883                                if (value != null) {
884                                        value = PercentCodec.decode(value, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
885                                }
886
887                        }
888                        if (key.isBlank()) {
889                                continue;
890                        }
891                        consumer.accept(key, value);
892                }
893        }
894
895        /**
896         * Common static log properties such as System properties ane environment variables.
897         */
898        @CaseChanging
899        enum StandardProperties implements LogProperties {
900
901                /**
902                 * Empty properties. The order is <code>-1</code>.
903                 */
904                EMPTY {
905                        @Override
906                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
907                                return null;
908                        }
909
910                        @Override
911                        public int order() {
912                                return -1;
913                        }
914                },
915                /**
916                 * Uses {@link System#getProperty(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}. The
917                 * {@link #order()} is <code>400</code> which the same value as microprofile
918                 * config ordinal.
919                 */
920                SYSTEM_PROPERTIES {
921                        @Override
922                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
923                                return System.getProperty(key);
924                        }
925
926                        @Override
927                        public int order() {
928                                return 400;
929                        }
930                },
931                /**
932                 * Uses {@link System#getenv(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}.The
933                 * {@link #order()} is <code>300</code> which is the same value as microprofile
934                 * config ordinal.
935                 */
936                ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES {
937                        @Override
938                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
939                                return System.getenv(translateKey(key));
940                        }
941
942                        @Override
943                        protected String translateKey(String key) {
944                                return key.replace(".", "_");
945                        }
946
947                };
948
949                @Override
950                public String description(String key) {
951                        String k = translateKey(key);
952                        String description = "'" + key + "' from " + name();
953                        if (!k.equals(key)) {
954                                description += "[" + k + "]";
955                        }
956                        return description;
957                }
958
959                protected String translateKey(String key) {
960                        return key;
961                }
962
963        }
964
965        /**
966         * An error friendly {@link Function} for converting properties.
967         *
968         * @param <T> input type.
969         * @param <R> output type.
970         * @param <E> error type.
971         */
972        public interface PropertyFunction<T extends @Nullable Object, R extends @Nullable Object, E extends Exception>
973                        extends Function<T, R> {
974
975                @Override
976                default R apply(T t) {
977                        try {
978                                return _apply(t);
979                        }
980                        catch (Exception e) {
981                                sneakyThrow(e);
982                                throw new RuntimeException(e);
983                        }
984                }
985
986                /**
987                 * Apply that throws error.
988                 * @param t input
989                 * @return output
990                 * @throws E if an error happened in function.
991                 */
992                public R _apply(T t) throws E;
993
994                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
995                private static <E extends Throwable> void sneakyThrow(final Throwable x) throws E {
996                        throw (E) x;
997                }
998
999        }
1000
1001        /**
1002         * Parent interface for property exceptions.
1003         */
1004        sealed interface PropertyProblem {
1005
1006        }
1007
1008        /**
1009         * Thrown if an error happens while converting a property.
1010         */
1011        final static class PropertyConvertException extends RuntimeException implements PropertyProblem {
1012
1013                private static final long serialVersionUID = -6260241455268426342L;
1014
1015                /**
1016                 * Key.
1017                 */
1018                private final String key;
1019
1020                /**
1021                 * Creates convert exception.
1022                 * @param key property key.
1023                 * @param message error message
1024                 * @param cause maybe null.
1025                 */
1026                PropertyConvertException(String key, String message, @Nullable Throwable cause) {
1027                        super(message, cause);
1028                        this.key = key;
1029                }
1030
1031                /**
1032                 * Property key.
1033                 * @return key.
1034                 */
1035                public String key() {
1036                        return this.key;
1037                }
1038
1039        }
1040
1041        /**
1042         * Throw if property is missing.
1043         */
1044        final static class PropertyMissingException extends NoSuchElementException implements PropertyProblem {
1045
1046                private static final long serialVersionUID = 4203076848052565692L;
1047
1048                /**
1049                 * Creates a missing propety exception.
1050                 * @param s error message.
1051                 */
1052                PropertyMissingException(String s) {
1053                        super(s);
1054                }
1055
1056        }
1057
1058        /**
1059         * Searches a {@value LogProperties#SEP} separated property path recursing up the path
1060         * till a non null value (not missing) is found.
1061         * <p>
1062         * For example assume we have a single property set like
1063         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff=DEBUG</code> and we call this function with
1064         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code>.
1065         * <ol>
1066         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1067         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1068         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff</code> will resolve to <code>"DEBUG"</code>, stop
1069         * and return <code>"DEBUG"</code>.</li>
1070         * </ol>
1071         * @param <T> type to return.
1072         * @param key the initial path.
1073         * @param resolveFunc function that returns the value at path or <code>null</code>.
1074         * @return value or <code>null</code>.
1075         */
1076        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
1077        public static <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T searchPath(String key,
1078                        Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc) {
1079                return searchPath(key, resolveFunc, SEP);
1080        }
1081
1082        private static <T> @Nullable T searchPath(String key, Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc, String sep) {
1083                String tempName = key;
1084                T level = null;
1085                int indexOfLastDot = tempName.length();
1086                while ((level == null) && (indexOfLastDot > -1)) {
1087                        tempName = tempName.substring(0, indexOfLastDot);
1088                        level = resolveFunc.apply(tempName);
1089                        indexOfLastDot = tempName.lastIndexOf(sep);
1090                }
1091                if (level != null) {
1092                        return level;
1093                }
1094                return resolveFunc.apply("");
1095        }
1096
1097        /**
1098         * Concats a key using {@link #SEP} to the root prefix.
1099         * @param name key.
1100         * @return concat key.
1101         */
1102        static String concatKey(String name) {
1103                return concatKey(LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX, name);
1104        }
1105
1106        /**
1107         * Concats a keys using {@link #SEP} as the separator.
1108         * @param prefix start of key.
1109         * @param name second part of key.
1110         * @return key.
1111         */
1112        static String concatKey(String prefix, String name) {
1113                if (name.equals("")) {
1114                        return prefix;
1115                }
1116                if (prefix.equals("")) {
1117                        return name;
1118                }
1119                if (prefix.endsWith(".")) {
1120                        prefix = prefix.substring(0, prefix.length() - 1);
1121                }
1122                if (name.startsWith(SEP)) {
1123                        return prefix + name;
1124                }
1125                return prefix + SEP + name;
1126        }
1127
1128        /**
1129         * Replace "{name}" tokens in property names.
1130         * @param key property name.
1131         * @param parameters tokens to replace with entry values.
1132         * @return interpolated property key.
1133         */
1134        static String interpolateKey(String key, Map<String, String> parameters) {
1135                for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : parameters.entrySet()) {
1136                        key = key.replace("{" + entry.getKey() + "}", entry.getValue());
1137                }
1138                return key;
1139        }
1140
1141        /**
1142         * Interpolates a named key which is a property key that has a {@value #NAME}.
1143         * @param key with name parameters.
1144         * @param name replace name token.
1145         * @return interpolated property key.
1146         */
1147        static String interpolateNamedKey(String key, String name) {
1148                return interpolateKey(key, Map.of(NAME, name));
1149        }
1150
1151        /**
1152         * Remove key prefix from the key. Prefix should end in "." but this method does not
1153         * check that.
1154         * @param key key whose prefix will be removed.
1155         * @param prefix property name prefix.
1156         * @return prefix removed if the string is prefixed.
1157         */
1158        static String removeKeyPrefix(String key, String prefix) {
1159                if (key.startsWith(prefix)) {
1160                        return key.substring(prefix.length());
1161                }
1162                return key;
1163        }
1164
1165        /**
1166         * Property prefix parameter pattern.
1167         */
1168        static final Pattern PARAMETER_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\{(.*?)\\}");
1169
1170        /**
1171         * Extract key parameters with {@link #PARAMETER_PATTERN}.
1172         * @param key also known as property name.
1173         * @return parameters in key.
1174         */
1175        static Set<String> keyParameters(String key) {
1176                Set<String> tokens = new LinkedHashSet<>();
1177                Matcher matcher = PARAMETER_PATTERN.matcher(key);
1178                while (matcher.find()) {
1179                        var t = matcher.group(1);
1180                        if (t == null) {
1181                                throw new IllegalStateException("bug with parameter pattern regex.");
1182                        }
1183                        tokens.add(t);
1184                }
1185                return tokens;
1186        }
1187
1188        private static void validateKeyParameters(String key, Set<String> parameters) {
1189                var keyParameters = keyParameters(key);
1190                if (!parameters.equals(keyParameters)) {
1191                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Keyed parameter mismatch. key is parameters: " + keyParameters
1192                                        + " provided parameters: " + parameters);
1193                }
1194        }
1195
1196        /**
1197         * The result of a property fetched from properties.
1198         *
1199         * @param <T> property type.
1200         */
1201        sealed interface Result<T> {
1202
1203                /**
1204                 * Gets the value.
1205                 * @return value or <code>null</code>.
1206                 */
1207                public @Nullable T valueOrNull();
1208
1209                /**
1210                 * Gets a value if there is if not uses the fallback.
1211                 * @param fallback maybe <code>null</code>.
1212                 * @return value.
1213                 */
1214                default @Nullable T valueOrNull(@Nullable T fallback) {
1215                        var v = valueOrNull();
1216                        if (v != null) {
1217                                return v;
1218                        }
1219                        return fallback;
1220                }
1221
1222                /**
1223                 * Gets the value and will fail with {@link NoSuchElementException} if there is no
1224                 * value.
1225                 * @return value.
1226                 * @throws PropertyMissingException if there is no value.
1227                 * @throws PropertyConvertException if the property failed conversion.
1228                 */
1229                public T value() throws PropertyMissingException, PropertyConvertException;
1230
1231                /**
1232                 * Gets a value if there if not uses the fallback if not null otherwise throws an
1233                 * exception.
1234                 * @param fallback maybe <code>null</code>.
1235                 * @return value.
1236                 * @throws PropertyMissingException if no property and fallback is
1237                 * <code>null</code>.
1238                 * @throws PropertyConvertException if the property failed conversion.
1239                 */
1240                default T value(@Nullable T fallback) throws PropertyMissingException, PropertyConvertException {
1241                        if (fallback == null) {
1242                                return value();
1243                        }
1244                        return value(() -> fallback);
1245                }
1246
1247                /**
1248                 * Gets a value if there if not uses the fallback if not null otherwise throws an
1249                 * exception.
1250                 * @param fallback maybe <code>null</code>.
1251                 * @return value.
1252                 * @throws PropertyMissingException if no property and fallback is
1253                 * <code>null</code>.
1254                 * @throws PropertyConvertException if the property failed conversion.
1255                 */
1256                public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1257                                throws PropertyMissingException, PropertyConvertException;
1258
1259                /**
1260                 * Convenience that turns a value into an optional.
1261                 * @return optional.
1262                 */
1263                default Optional<T> optional() {
1264                        return Optional.ofNullable(valueOrNull());
1265                }
1266
1267                /**
1268                 * A property that is present.
1269                 *
1270                 * @param <T> property type.
1271                 * @param value actual value.
1272                 */
1273                public record Success<T>(T value) implements RequiredResult<T> {
1274                        /**
1275                         * Succesfully found property value.
1276                         * @param value actual value should not be <code>null</code>.
1277                         */
1278                        public Success {
1279                                if (value == null) {
1280                                        throw new NullPointerException("value");
1281                                }
1282                        }
1283
1284                        @Override
1285                        public @Nullable T valueOrNull() {
1286                                return value();
1287                        }
1288
1289                        @Override
1290                        public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1291                                        throws NoSuchElementException {
1292                                return value;
1293                        }
1294                }
1295
1296                /**
1297                 * A property that is missing (<code>null</code>).
1298                 *
1299                 * @param <T> property type.
1300                 * @param message description of where the property is missing.
1301                 */
1302                public record Missing<T>(String message) implements Result<T> {
1303                        @Override
1304                        public @Nullable T valueOrNull() {
1305                                return null;
1306                        }
1307
1308                        @Override
1309                        public T value() throws NoSuchElementException {
1310                                throw new PropertyMissingException(message);
1311                        }
1312
1313                        @Override
1314                        public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1315                                        throws NoSuchElementException {
1316                                var v = fallback.get();
1317                                if (v != null) {
1318                                        return v;
1319                                }
1320                                throw new PropertyMissingException(message);
1321                        }
1322
1323                        /**
1324                         * Helper just to cast the result to a different parameterized type.
1325                         * @param <R> paramterized type.
1326                         * @return this.
1327                         */
1328                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1329                        public <R> Missing<R> convert() {
1330                                return (Missing<R>) this;
1331                        }
1332
1333                }
1334
1335                /**
1336                 * A property that was present but failed conversion.
1337                 *
1338                 * @param <T> property type.
1339                 * @param key property key that failed to convert.
1340                 * @param message failure message.
1341                 * @param cause exception thrown while trying to convert.
1342                 */
1343                public record Error<T>(String key, String message, Exception cause) implements RequiredResult<T> {
1344
1345                        @Override
1346                        public @Nullable T valueOrNull() {
1347                                throw new PropertyConvertException(key, message, cause);
1348                        }
1349
1350                        @Override
1351                        public T value() throws NoSuchElementException {
1352                                throw new PropertyConvertException(key, message, cause);
1353                        }
1354
1355                        @Override
1356                        public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1357                                        throws NoSuchElementException {
1358                                throw new PropertyConvertException(key, message, cause);
1359                        }
1360
1361                        /**
1362                         * Helper just to cast the result to a different parameterized type.
1363                         * @param <R> paramterized type.
1364                         * @return this.
1365                         */
1366                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1367                        public <R> Error<R> convert() {
1368                                return (Error<R>) this;
1369                        }
1370                }
1371
1372        }
1373
1374        /**
1375         * A result that is not missing and will either be an error or success.
1376         *
1377         * @param <T> property type.
1378         */
1379        sealed interface RequiredResult<T> extends Result<T> {
1380
1381        }
1382
1383        /**
1384         * A property description that can retrieve a property result by being passed
1385         * {@link LogProperties}. <em>The property instance does not actually contain the
1386         * value of the property!</em>.
1387         *
1388         * @param <T> property type.
1389         * @see RequiredProperty
1390         * @see Result
1391         */
1392        sealed interface Property<T> {
1393
1394                /**
1395                 * Gets the first key.
1396                 * @return key.
1397                 */
1398                public String key();
1399
1400                /**
1401                 * Gets a property value as a result.
1402                 * @param properties key values.
1403                 * @return result.
1404                 */
1405                public Result<T> get(LogProperties properties);
1406
1407                /**
1408                 * Maps the property to another value type.
1409                 * @param <U> value type.
1410                 * @param mapper function to map.
1411                 * @return property.
1412                 */
1413                public <U> Property<U> map(PropertyFunction<? super T, ? extends U, ? super Exception> mapper);
1414
1415                /**
1416                 * Converts the value into a String that can be parsed by the builtin properties
1417                 * parsing of types. Supported types: String, Boolean, Integer, URI, Map, List.
1418                 * @param value to be converted to string.
1419                 * @return property representation of value.
1420                 */
1421                public String propertyString(T value);
1422
1423                /**
1424                 * Set a property if its not null.
1425                 * @param value value to set.
1426                 * @param consumer first parameter is first key and second parameter is non null
1427                 * value.
1428                 */
1429                public void set(T value, BiConsumer<String, T> consumer);
1430
1431                /**
1432                 * Programmatically check if a value that corresponds to this property is not
1433                 * null.
1434                 * @param value maybe <code>null</code> but an exception will be thrown if it is.
1435                 * @return value if not null.
1436                 * @throws NoSuchElementException if the value is null.
1437                 * @apiNote this is an expected exception and should not be treated as crashable
1438                 * exception that should avoided with static analysis such as checkerframework and
1439                 * is why the input argument is nullable.
1440                 */
1441                default T require(@Nullable T value) {
1442                        if (value == null) {
1443                                throw new PropertyMissingException("Value is required not null. property key='" + key() + "'");
1444                        }
1445                        return value;
1446                }
1447
1448                /**
1449                 * Builder.
1450                 * @return builder.
1451                 */
1452                public static RootPropertyGetter builder() {
1453                        return PropertyGetter.of();
1454                }
1455
1456        }
1457
1458        /**
1459         * A property that should never be missing usually because there is non-null fallback.
1460         *
1461         * @param <T> property type.
1462         */
1463        sealed interface RequiredProperty<T> extends Property<T> {
1464
1465                /**
1466                 * Gets a property value as a result.
1467                 * @param properties key values.
1468                 * @return result.
1469                 */
1470                public RequiredResult<T> get(LogProperties properties);
1471
1472                /**
1473                 * Maps the property to another value type.
1474                 * @param <U> value type.
1475                 * @param mapper function to map.
1476                 * @return property.
1477                 */
1478                public <U> RequiredProperty<U> map(PropertyFunction<? super T, ? extends U, ? super Exception> mapper);
1479
1480        }
1481
1482        /**
1483         * Extracts and converts from {@link LogProperties} and is also an immutable builder
1484         * for {@link Property}s.
1485         *
1486         * @param <T> value type.
1487         */
1488        sealed interface PropertyGetter<T> {
1489
1490                /**
1491                 * Gets a result from properties.
1492                 * @param props properties.
1493                 * @param key property key usually dotted.
1494                 * @return result.
1495                 */
1496                Result<T> get(LogProperties props, String key);
1497
1498                /**
1499                 * Gets a result from properties by trying a list of keys.
1500                 * @param props properties.
1501                 * @param keys list of property keys usually dotted.
1502                 * @return result.
1503                 */
1504                default Result<T> get(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1505                        for (String key : keys) {
1506                                var r = get(props, key);
1507                                @Nullable
1508                                Result<T> found = switch (r) {
1509                                        case Result.Success<T> s -> s;
1510                                        case Result.Error<T> s -> s;
1511                                        case Result.Missing<T> s -> null;
1512                                };
1513                                if (found != null) {
1514                                        return found;
1515                                }
1516                        }
1517                        return findRoot(this).missingResult(props, keys);
1518                }
1519
1520                /**
1521                 * Converts the value into a String that can be parsed by the builtin properties
1522                 * parsing of types. Supported types: String, Boolean, Integer, URI, Map, List.
1523                 * @param value to be converted to string.
1524                 * @return property representation of value.
1525                 */
1526                String propertyString(T value);
1527
1528                /**
1529                 * Determines full name of key.
1530                 * @param key key.
1531                 * @return fully qualified key name.
1532                 */
1533                default String fullyQualifiedKey(String key) {
1534                        return findRoot(this).fullyQualifiedKey(key);
1535                }
1536
1537                /**
1538                 * Validates the key is correctly prefixed.
1539                 * @param key dotted key.
1540                 */
1541                default void validateKey(String key) {
1542                        String fqn = fullyQualifiedKey(key);
1543                        if (!fqn.startsWith(LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX)) {
1544                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1545                                                "Property key should start with: '" + LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX + "'. key = " + key);
1546                        }
1547                        if (fqn.endsWith(".") || fqn.startsWith(".")) {
1548                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1549                                                "Property key should not start or end with '" + LogProperties.SEP + "'");
1550                        }
1551                        validateKeyParameters(key, Set.of());
1552                }
1553
1554                /**
1555                 * Creates a Property from the given key and this getter.
1556                 * @param key key.
1557                 * @return property.
1558                 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the key is malformed.
1559                 */
1560                default Property<T> build(String key) throws IllegalArgumentException {
1561                        validateKey(key);
1562                        return new DefaultProperty<>(this, List.of(key));
1563                }
1564
1565                /**
1566                 * Creates a Property from the given key and its {@value LogProperties#NAME}
1567                 * parameter.
1568                 * @param key key.
1569                 * @param name interpolates <code>{name}</code> in property name with this value.
1570                 * @return property.
1571                 */
1572                default Property<T> buildWithName(String key, String name) {
1573                        var parameters = Map.of(NAME, name);
1574                        validateKeyParameters(key, parameters.keySet());
1575                        String fqn = LogProperties.interpolateKey(key, parameters);
1576                        return build(fqn);
1577                }
1578
1579                /**
1580                 * Find root property getter.
1581                 * @param e property getter.
1582                 * @return root.
1583                 */
1584                public static RootPropertyGetter findRoot(PropertyGetter<?> e) {
1585                        return switch (e) {
1586                                case RootPropertyGetter r -> r;
1587                                case ChildPropertyGetter<?> c -> findRoot(c.parent());
1588                        };
1589                }
1590
1591                /**
1592                 * Default root property getter.
1593                 * @return property getter.
1594                 */
1595                public static RootPropertyGetter of() {
1596                        return new RootPropertyGetter("", false);
1597                }
1598
1599                /**
1600                 * A property getter and <strong>builder</strong> that has no conversion but may
1601                 * prefix the key and search recursively up the key path.
1602                 * <p>
1603                 * While you can map the string properties with {@link #map(PropertyFunction)} it
1604                 * is preferred to use the <code>to</code> methods on this class for basic types
1605                 * especially for list or map types as the implementation will call the
1606                 * implementation specific in LogProperties. An example is {@link #toMap()} which
1607                 * will call the LogProperties implementration of
1608                 * {@link LogProperties#mapOrNull(String)}.
1609                 *
1610                 * @param prefix added to the key before looking up in {@link LogProperties}.
1611                 * @param search if true will recursively search up the key path
1612                 */
1613                record RootPropertyGetter(String prefix, boolean search) implements PropertyGetter<String> {
1614
1615                        // @Override
1616                        private @Nullable String valueOrNull(LogProperties props, String key) {
1617                                if (search) {
1618                                        return props.search(prefix, key);
1619                                }
1620                                return props.valueOrNull(fullyQualifiedKey(key));
1621                        }
1622
1623                        private <T> @Nullable T valueOrNull(LogProperties props, String key,
1624                                        BiFunction<LogProperties, String, @Nullable T> func) {
1625                                if (search) {
1626                                        return props.search(prefix, key, func);
1627                                }
1628                                return func.apply(props, fullyQualifiedKey(key));
1629                        }
1630
1631                        <T> Result<T> get(LogProperties props, String key, BiFunction<LogProperties, String, @Nullable T> func) {
1632                                var v = valueOrNull(props, key, func);
1633                                if (v == null) {
1634                                        return missingResult(props, List.of(key));
1635                                }
1636                                return new Result.Success<>(v);
1637                        }
1638
1639                        @Override
1640                        public Result<String> get(LogProperties props, String key) {
1641                                var v = valueOrNull(props, key);
1642                                if (v == null) {
1643                                        return missingResult(props, List.of(key));
1644                                }
1645                                return new Result.Success<>(v);
1646                        }
1647
1648                        @Override
1649                        public String propertyString(String value) {
1650                                return value;
1651                        }
1652
1653                        <T> Result.Error<T> errorResult(LogProperties props, String key, Exception e) {
1654                                String resolvedKey = props.description(fullyQualifiedKey(key));
1655                                String message = "Error for property. key: '" + resolvedKey + "', " + e.getMessage();
1656                                return new Result.Error<>(resolvedKey, message, e);
1657                        }
1658
1659                        <T> Result.Missing<T> missingResult(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1660                                List<String> resolvedKeys = describeKeys(props, keys);
1661                                String message = "Property missing. keys: " + resolvedKeys;
1662                                return new Result.Missing<>(message);
1663                        }
1664
1665                        List<String> describeKeys(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1666                                return keys.stream().map(k -> props.description(fullyQualifiedKey(k))).toList();
1667                        }
1668
1669                        /**
1670                         * Will search with prefix.
1671                         * @param prefix prefix.
1672                         * @return new property getter.
1673                         */
1674                        public RootPropertyGetter withSearch(String prefix) {
1675                                return new RootPropertyGetter(prefix, true);
1676                        }
1677
1678                        /**
1679                         * Will prefix key.
1680                         * @param prefix prefix.
1681                         * @return new property getter.
1682                         */
1683                        public RootPropertyGetter withPrefix(String prefix) {
1684                                return new RootPropertyGetter(prefix, search);
1685                        }
1686
1687                        @Override
1688                        public String fullyQualifiedKey(String key) {
1689                                return concatKey(prefix, key);
1690                        }
1691
1692                        /**
1693                         * An integer property getter.
1694                         * @return getter that will convert to integers.
1695                         */
1696                        public PropertyGetter<Integer> toInt() {
1697                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, Integer::parseInt, String::valueOf);
1698                        }
1699
1700                        /**
1701                         * A boolean property getter.
1702                         * @return getter that will convert to boolean.
1703                         */
1704                        public PropertyGetter<Boolean> toBoolean() {
1705                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, Boolean::parseBoolean, String::valueOf);
1706                        }
1707
1708                        /**
1709                         * A Map property that will use {@link LogProperties#mapOrNull(String)}.
1710                         * @return getter that will convert string property to a Map.
1711                         */
1712                        public PropertyGetter<Map<String, String>> toMap() {
1713                                return new MapGetter(this);
1714                        }
1715
1716                        /**
1717                         * A list property that will use {@link LogProperties#listOrNull(String)}.
1718                         * @return getter that will convert string property to a List.
1719                         */
1720                        public PropertyGetter<List<String>> toList() {
1721                                return new ListGetter(this);
1722                        }
1723
1724                        /**
1725                         * An enum property getter using {@link Enum#valueOf(Class, String)}.
1726                         * @param <T> enum type.
1727                         * @param enumClass enum class.
1728                         * @return getter that will convert to enum type.
1729                         */
1730                        public <T extends Enum<T>> PropertyGetter<T> toEnum(Class<T> enumClass) {
1731                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, s -> Enum.valueOf(enumClass, s), String::valueOf);
1732                        }
1733
1734                        /**
1735                         * A URI property getter that parses URIs.
1736                         * @return getter that will parse URIs.
1737                         */
1738                        public PropertyGetter<URI> toURI() {
1739                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, URI::new, String::valueOf);
1740                        }
1741
1742                }
1743
1744                /**
1745                 * Mapped property getter.
1746                 *
1747                 * @param <T> will convert to this type.
1748                 */
1749                public sealed interface ChildPropertyGetter<T> extends PropertyGetter<T> {
1750
1751                        /**
1752                         * Parent.
1753                         * @return parent.
1754                         */
1755                        PropertyGetter<?> parent();
1756
1757                        @Override
1758                        default String propertyString(T value) {
1759                                return switch (value) {
1760                                        case null -> throw new NullPointerException("null value passed into propertyString");
1761                                        case String s -> s;
1762                                        case Boolean b -> String.valueOf(b);
1763                                        case Integer i -> String.valueOf(i);
